replies.body: They went from a good design to a really basic design, it looks like something you'll print on a shirt.

> [{quoted}](name=Deathraven13,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=e0aZKe1Y,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-04-17T12:55:53.875+0000)
>
> They went from a good design to a really basic design, it looks like something you'll print on a shirt.

Their old design is actually a pretty terrible logo from a design standpoint. It uses ragged edging, multiple shading areas, and doesn't particularly lend itself to being easily replicated. It's an amateur logo, and while it has charms, it also screams of a dated era from long ago that evokes the images of game like Crash Bandicoot and Spyro. 
 
The new logo is modern, cleaner, crisp, and while I personally don't like the font, it's smooth and easy to replicate. It also uses a lot less colors, which means it can be applied to many different backgrounds and such much easier than something with multiple shades. It fluidly fits into modern design standards, and is a little more timeless, so going forward it won't look like it's a relic from the 90s/00s so unabashedly as their old logo does.

While I agree with you about their old logo... the big problem with their new logo: There's nothing INTERESTING about it. It's entirely forgettable.

A logo needs to have SOMETHING about it that stands out to be effective. Even the fist in the logo looks bored.

> [{quoted}](name=Eleshakai,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=e0aZKe1Y,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2019-04-17T14:59:44.745+0000)

Compared to logos like those below, I don't particularly see the case that it needs to be complicated or have some aspect that stands out and screams in your face to be effective. These are all logos of MAJOR brands, and they all go for sweet, simple, and modern. Riot's new logo mimics most of them, actually, in that it's a pictographic paired with simple text.

https://www.logolynx.com/images/logolynx/5b/5bc63fc882d3fa02619c0a702a96c820.png
https://1gew6o3qn6vx9kp3s42ge0y1-wpengine.netdna-ssl.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/08/8867.Microsoft_5F00_Logo_2D00_for_2D00_screen.jpg
https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/b3/Taco_Bell_2016.svg/1200px-Taco_Bell_2016.svg.png
https://www.gap.com/Asset_Archive/search/logos/Old_Navy.jpg
https://cdn.wccftech.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Square-Enix-H1-2019-01-Square-Enix-Logo.jpg

The difference in some of these cases is that they've changed their logos a few times, and now some part of their logo IS iconic enough to pop out on its own. 

The Golden Arches, the bell, the apple logo, Microsoft's little squares.... those are all things that have such power on their own that they stand out. Riot's little fist... doesn't. Especially since they CHANGED THE FIST from the version that they used in their old logo.

I would argue that Old Navy and Squenix's logos on their own are not well designed either, personally. Since there's nothing about them that you'd see and immediately go 'oh that's them!'. All the others have something that is so iconic and unique to them that you know it without thinking.

The fist has changed as much as Apple's apple or the Taco Bell Bell. It's still a fist, it still looks pretty much like the old version, and given that Riot isn't as big of a brand as any of the companies I've listed, obviously their fist won't have as much power on it's own until it establishes itself more. I personally recognize it as Riot's fist, as does the majority of players, I'd wager.

*shrugs* Judging by the number of people who hate the logo, I think not.

The new logo is just boring. I see it and my eyes just pass over it, not even noticing it. It has no interest to it. The font is bland, the fist has no punch. There's no colour variation to catch the eye, nothing. There's literally nothing interesting about it.

Every one of those logos you put, except Old Navy, has SOMETHING about it that stands out. McDonald's has 3 colours and the giant golden arches, Apple's apple is like twice the size of the text, making it what you see immediately. Microsoft's logo has several colours, as well as an interesting font choice. Taco Bell has the unique black and purple aesthetic, as well as a giant emblem. Square Enix has the two red marks in the Es to create a visual focal point as well as an interesting font.(I still think Squenix Logo is bad, but it's better than Riot's)

The only thing that is distinctive about Riot's logo is the 'i' in Riot, and with the way the logo is printed it looks like a mistake/misprint to me(even though I know that's been a part of their logo forever)

Honestly, with how much League changed since season 1, I kinda like the logo. It's minimalistic but also looks really modern. It kinda seems like a testament of how much League has changed. The old logo, looks kinda messy, and rough like graffiti. Compare that to maps in season 1, which also looked messy and rough.
The new logo seems a lot cleaner and smoother, much like the game today. 
If they just make the overall design a bit bigger, I think it'll be great
